pitch_me_signals.title: Investors Open to Pitches
pitch_me_signals.description: Active signals from VC investors explicitly welcoming cybersecurity and early-stage startup pitches (LinkedIn activity only)

signals.summary: Left YL Ventures, now helping founders ideating on what to build. Explicitly offering to be a thought partner for early-stage cyber founders (Seed/A).
signals.excerpt: Founders who are ideating on what to build and want a thought partner on where to focus. If that's you, reach out.
signals.ktlyst_alignment: PERFECT - explicitly seeking early-stage cyber founders to advise

signals.summary: WitnessAI raised $58M strategic round, launching WitnessAI Agentic Security - directly relevant to KTLYST's agentic security positioning

signals.ktlyst_alignment: PERFECT - Agentic Security is directly in KTLYST's space

signals.summary: Actively building AI agent tools (OpenClaw, Moltbook, Chewbarka) - demonstrates hands-on engagement with agentic AI technology. Posted 'The dreaming/just build it mindset' showing personal experimentation with AI assistants that do calendar alerts, Twitter monitoring, daily briefings.
signals.excerpt: As I've been hacking away at OpenClaw and Moltbook... Chewbarka - I'm your AI assistant living on your server.

signals.summary: Actively receiving agentic startup pitches: 'As an investor, I am getting many Agentic startup pitches every day'

new_funds.title: Recent Fund Announcements
new_funds.description: New funds raised by investors relevant to cybersecurity and AI (actual investor activity)

signals.thesis: Boldstart Fund VII ($250M) announcement on LinkedIn - targeting AI founders at early/embryonic stages for autonomous enterprise

Boldstart Ventures Fund VII announced - $250M AI fund targeting early/embryonic stage founders building autonomous enterprise. Also celebrated Protect AI acquisition by Palo Alto Networks at RSAC2025.
Bessemer invested in Upwind Security - $250M Series B at $1.5B valuation for cloud security startup
Claroty raised $150M+ at $3B valuation - third mega round from Team8 portfolio (following Port.io $100M and Classiq $130M)

daily.executive_summary: Today's intelligence reveals strong industry momentum around AI security automation and detection engineering, with multiple technical discussions on SOC noise reduction and autonomous security agents. While no explicit VC pitch-me signals were captured, the convergence of AI governance enforcement and detection-as-code themes suggests growing investor interest in KTLYST's core thesis areas.
recommended_actions: Engage with technical security communities discussing SOC noise reduction and detection engineering to build thought leadership
Monitor for follow-up VC activity around AI governance and security automation themes that gained traction this week
Prepare targeted outreach materials highlighting KTLYST's detection-as-code approach, given the industry focus on 'Living off the Land' attack detection and SIEM false positive reduction

weekly.executive_summary: This week shows strong momentum in agentic AI security with WitnessAI's $58M round validating the space KTLYST is building in. Key investors are actively discussing AI agent security risks and SOC automation, while industry content highlights persistent SIEM noise and detection engineering challenges that align perfectly with KTLYST's solution focus.

monthly.executive_summary: The cybersecurity investment landscape shows strong momentum around agentic AI and autonomous security platforms, with multiple major rounds (WitnessAI $58M, Resolve.ai $125M at $1B valuation) validating KTLYST's thesis. Key investors are actively seeking agentic security startups, with Ed Sim announcing Boldstart's $250M Fund VII specifically targeting early-stage autonomous enterprise solutions, while Chenxi Wang reports receiving daily agentic startup pitches.
